page.title: 02LOCAL GEOGRAPHY
page.content: Youlgrave is l76m above sea level and 95% of the land is covered by fields and woodlands. The fields are enclosed by dry limestone and gritstone walls. The{Lathkill}and{Bradford}are rivers that run through two beautiful dales. Houses are made of covered bricks, limestone or gritstone. Youlgrave has three pubs, seven shops, a school and a post office. There is a parish church and two chapels. There are 20 farms (mainly dairy) with 30 to 500 acres of land which are used for grazing or growing crops like barley, hay and silage. Other industries include a silversmiths, a sock factory and a limestone quarry. Many disused lead mine shafts and Mawstone Mine, closed following a fatal accident in 1932, lie to the south of the village. The hamlet of{Alport}has a trout farm. Nicholas Margree (11)
